New Records: History is made: Netherlands beat South Africa for the first time across any format.
Key Match Events: Brandon Glover took 3 wickets for 9 runs.
Fred Klaassen took 2 wickets for 20 runs.
Keshav Maharaj was caught by O'Dowd off de Leede for 13 runs.
Heinrich Klaasen was caught by van Beek off de Leede for 21 runs.
South Africa's NRR falls below Pakistan's, which means they are officially knocked out.
South Africa's entire top six threw away starts.
Netherlands' catching proved crucial in the end: Markram was nabbed sharply at short cover to break a stable stand, and Miller was caught by van der Merwe.
Post-Match Reflections: Colin Ackermann: 'Feels fantastic, we really deserved this victory! Boys worked really hard. Come in, and take it deep, and the boundaries flowed at the end. Surface was slow, and was taking a bit of turn.'

Edwards: 'Lost for words! It's going to take a bit of time... we are sort of used to those conditions. It's definitely up there - another big upset for Netherlands in a World Cup! We were still playing for a spot in the next World Cup.'

Bavuma: 'Hard one to swallow. We had the confidence and belief in ourselves as a unit to make the play-offs. Unfortunately for us, we couldn't do it. Winning the toss and bowling, what they got wasn't ideal. We lost wickets at crucial times. They used the dimensions of the field a lot better than we did.'
Boucher: 'Our energies were low; Netherlands outbowled us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Result guarantees India a spot in the semi-finals, while the Bangladesh vs Pakistan match becomes a knockout.
South Africa's loss ensures India are through to the semi-final, and keeps the door open for Pakistan and Bangladesh.
